result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Dennis Poler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott Dennis Poler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott Dennis Poler was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Scott Dennis Poler was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jail term in count #1 in case #16CF62

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No possession or consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns. No contact with victim (WM) or his property/premises.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first year of probation.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as Count #2, with no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Probation on Count #2

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott Dennis Poler in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:21 PM. Called 15CF148 & 16CF62. State - resolved. Schole - 15CF148 - plead to counts #2, #3 and #4 and #1 to be DRI, imposed and stay 9 months in county jail on counts #2 and #3, consecutive to each other, stayed and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: costs, restitution of  $440.00, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, 150 hours of community service, no contact with victim WM or his property, count #4 - 30 days in FC jail; 16CF62 - amend count #1 to misd bail jumping - plead G to amended count #1, 30 days in FC jail - consecutive to jail time on 15CF148, costs, #2 - DRI. State and Polar agree. 15CF148 - Polar pleads G to counts #2, #3 and #4 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in count #1. 16CF62 - Court asks how the State will get 30 days jail on count #4 as it is charged as a forfeiture. State and Scholke discuss, State asks for 60 days jail on count #1 on 16CF62 then. Scholke and Polar willing to do that. Court dismisses count #4 on 15CF148.  On 16CF62 - Court amends count #1 to misd bail jumping contrary to 9469.49(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty. Polar pleads G to amended count #1. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 on 16CF62 and dismisses count #4 on 15CF148. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joing recommendation. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 2 days on 16CF62. Polar withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF148 - counts #2 and #3 - 9 months in FC jail - consecutive to each other - stayed - place on probation for 2 years with conditions of - concurrent to each other and to jail time: costs on each count - paid thru probation, restitution of $440.00 - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community service - to be completed within the first year of probation, no contact with victim WM or his property/premises, submit DNA sample with expunction rights; 16CF62 - count #1 - 60 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 2 days (stipulated) - report by 8:30 AM on Wednesday, 5/18/16, costs - paid within 60 days after release from incarceration, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott Dennis Poler in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Called at 1:50 PM. Scholke - not resolved - has gone over Frye with the defendant. State  15CF148 - plead to count #1 and #4, DRI #2 and #3, on count #1 - 3 years probation with 180 days of conditional jail, restitution of $440.00 plus VWS, #4 - 180 days of jail - concurrent to count #1; 16CF62 - plead to amended BJ under count #1, #2 - DRI, 90 days jail, consecutive to jail time on 15CF148. Court continues bond, sets both matters for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Scott Dennis Poler in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:01 PM. Also called 16CF62. Scholke - here for PH on 15CF148 and INIT on 16CF62. On 16CF62 - waives reading of criminal complaint, will waive PH for both cases and Court has waiver of PH form for both cases.  Court finds that the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH on both cases, finds probable cause on both cases, binds over for trial, on both cases. Scholke will proceed to ARGN as long as Information will mirror complaint on 15CF148 (to be filed within 10 days). Scholke pleads NG to both cases. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on both cases and sets both cases for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Scott Dennis Poler in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:56 AM. Poler has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Poler understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, has contacted SPD already and they are working on an appointment of an attorney, given court appointed paperwork in Court. Court sets for AIA. State - bond - $2000 signature bond. Court - bond - $2000.00 signature bond, no contact with Wilmer Mueller, no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.
